reviews.text: Honestly, I can't imagine staying here again. And I can't imagine staying here as a first-time visitor to Las Vegas. Really, find the few extra dollars to stay somewhere decent.
reviews.title: Ok for a budget stay

reviews.text: It's off strip, and it is far longer than a "10 minute walk" to the strip as another review mentioned.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.liked: — very clean rooms, just easy to deal with, shuttle to strip, nice cheap food, feels like old vegas
likes.disliked: — strip is more exciting but problems go with that too!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very basic rooms, tiny bathrooms, but no cleanliness issues, everything was clean enough..and old enough! Swimming pool
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: was tiny - a joke.
reviews.title: Great rates, great buffet. Can't beat it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took me over 90 minutes to check in on a Friday afternoon, and three trips back and forth to reception to get keys that worked and the right room type.
reviews.title: just off the strip

likes.liked: — the free donuts and drinks in the bingo
likes.disliked: — walking thru casino to get to rooms

reviews.text: A high school buddy and I recently stayed at the Gold Coast (June 25-27th). The casino delivers a clean, decent room at a very reasonable price, details follow:
reviews.title: Good value, decent rooms

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, flat panel TV, full service casino, price
likes.disliked: — Distance from Strip, pool, dining choices (noting the Rio is close though)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The room was of a very good size with reasonable wooden, "block" furniture. To the extent it would look like a dorm room, there is surprisingly tasteful paintings and lamps as well as a terrific flat screen TV. The bathroom is extremely small, however. I was in room 765. It was very quiet.
reviews.title: OK for the price

reviews.text: -The casino offers the full assortment of games and table minimums are very low. There is also a bingo parlor, which was of notable size and is fun to play in with the small computer terminals they give you.
reviews.title: They weren’t kidding about the small bathroom…

likes.liked: — The price, the staff, the buffet, and the loose slot machines.
likes.disliked: — Tiny bathroom and noisy air conditioning unit.

reviews.text: -There is a gigantic bowling alley, which is very modern and has a well appointed lounge that looks like it was very recently completed. The pool, however, is very small.
reviews.title: No question, this is a two star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Casino workers were friendly and approachable while the crowd at the casino seemed generally nice.
reviews.title: Overall good for the price

likes.liked: — The price and quietness of the room
likes.disliked: — The foam mattress and skimpy sheets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Gold Coast from 9/27 until 10/6. Overall, it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Good stay at Gold Coast

reviews.text: The first room we were given was right above the loading dock and terribly noisy. We asked to change and were given a second room. The lock was broken and we had to go to the front desk twice to get another entry card. A manager finally joined us upstairs on my third trip downstairs and confirmed that the lock was broken. We stayed in the third room we were assigned for the next eight days and enjoyed our magnificent view of the top of the air conditioning units.
reviews.title: Not quite the same
Gold Coast Fantastic Value!
reviews.text: The reason I gave this hotel an above average rating is because this hotel is the cleanest I have ever been in. The rooms, the casino, the restaurant and all the restrooms were spotless. The only dirt I found was in the elevator. Really above average cleanliness. The bathroom was very small and awkward but there was fantastic water pressure in the shower . The room was small and the air conditioner was loud and inefficient, but the bed and pillows were very comfortable and I am very particular about that. So for the little time you are in a hotel room in Las Vegas, there is a lot to be said for not having to worry about sleeping in an uncomfortable bed or in someone elses dirt.

reviews.title: a yearly "hidden treat"
reviews.text: The food was average, edible. The breakfast buffet had the same selections day after day but you cannot beat the cost, $5.95. The Rio has scrumptuous food and it is a short walk across the parking deck - more expensive but a zillion times better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our group's fourth visit to the Gold Coast in 3 years so we know what to expect and I think others have explained it pretty well. It is a good value for the money, but we thought it has taken a turn for the worse.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in some pretty crummy spots over the years and even running youth hostels myself I can only say this place was the cheesiest and worst amenities ever experienced! The clientele look as if they are waiting for a call from the funeral home, the corridors are from a Stephen King movie and the decor in therooms is so out of touch to be almost a museum piece for the bad taste section. And if these folks ever heard of AC in rooms they must have had a nutcase install it as all they do is channel hot air back in. Finally if you fall for the food....don't be surprised if you think MacDonalds is five star in comparison .....I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this dump!
reviews.title: From a horror movie!

reviews.text: Staying at the Gold Coast after reading the reviews, I was a bit nervous at the prospect. However, I was pleasantly surprised that the rooms were nice (I stayed in the one bedroom suite), the staff people from the reservations desk to the dealers were all really nice. Overall, it was a good trip and I would recommend this place for "low rollers." Craps is $5 min and roulette $3. Not many places compare at this level and are still clean hotels! This place is!! Oh, and there's even a full bowling alley!
reviews.title: Local Hotel with a cool feel

reviews.text: just got back from a 4-day stay there....
reviews.title: good hotel with loads of amenities

likes.liked: — shuttle to the strip, price, room cleanliness
likes.disliked: — some staff were a bit rude (but you'll probably get that anywhere)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: like others have said, the bathroom is small. But, you're not living in it - so no big deal. Enough room to shower and go to the bathroom. love the wall-mounted tvs. beds were the best of hotels I have stayed at in a long time..... didn't have the gross heavy bedspreads that many other mid-level hotels use. the bathrooms have the 1980s look (brown tub, brown toilet, brown sink counter, etc.) ... but all was pretty clean.
reviews.title: Serviceable but Not Spectacular

likes.disliked: — very smoky casino floor that you have to cross to get to elevators

reviews.text: casino was smoky, but all pretty much are.
reviews.title: One of the best stays ever

likes.liked: — room, dining, casino, gym, race/sports book
